report_title: Adhesive Tape Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Adhesive Tape Manufacturers produce various adhesive tapes for use across many industries, including office tape, rubber electrical tape, box-sealing tape and reflective road marking tape. Demand for adhesive tape products relies heavily on the health of downstream industries, including construction in manufacturing. The recent slowdown in demand for construction, mainly driven by weak commercial real estate performance, elevated inflation and high interest rates, has caused demand for tape products to shrink. Similarly, some of these factors have led to weaker disposable income, lowering discretionary spending and causing demand from the manufacturing sector to slow down. Although tape producers benefited from a spike in demand in 2021, unfavorable economic conditions caused revenue to continue declining. These trends are estimated to cause revenue to shrink at a CAGR of 0.5% to $248.6 million over the five years to 2023, including a 1.4% dip in 2023 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Demand from the Manufacturing Sector Fluctuates Based on Economic Conditions
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Adhesive tape is used broadly by many downstream manufacturing industries, including paper, office stationery resellers and any company offering shipping services to consumers. When economic conditions weaken, demand for discretionary purchases weakens, negatively impacting tape consumption. Elevated inflation over recent years has caused disposable income to fall, harming spending on premium purchases. As consumers lower discretionary spending, companies often follow and lower production. Weaker economic conditions also result in slower e-commerce activity, lowering the need for tape products. The healthcare sector has increased its use of adhesive tape over recent years, which became more popular during the pandemic, enabling revenue to expand in 2021.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Price competition is less relevant for tape producers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Manufacturers have faced significant input price volatility. Weaker demand for tape products from downstream industries prevented producers from passing down cost increases, resulting in shrinking profit.

Heavy-duty tapes, such as duct tape and reflective tape, are commonly used in construction activities. Growing demand for construction project boost specialized tape sales. The pandemic directly impacted the construction sector, as nonresidential construction took a direct hit from strict stay-at-home orders. Although the residential sector expanded during the initial stages of the pandemic because of historically low interest rates, recent interest rate hikes and uncertain economic conditions have led to weaker demand for residential construction. The falling overall value of construction has caused adhesive tape sales to weaken, a trend that has been enhanced by elevated inflation and rising borrowing costs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Foreign Competitors Turn Up The Heat
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Adhesive tape producers face intense competition from foreign manufacturers that benefit from lower labor costs and thus can offer competitive prices. Domestic producers that moved production offshore have further augmented this competition. The rising value of the US dollar has created room for imports to satisfy a greater portion of domestic demand. However, well-established producers with strong brand recognition and high-quality products have boosted demand for domestic tape both internally and among foreign markets. The impact of the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) on adhesive tape producers has been expanding. Imports and exports from Mexico and Canada, the two countries that benefit from the USMCA, have expanded rapidly, causing trade to become a more prominent threat to domestic producers and creating new opportunities for exporting companies.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: T A P E  P R O D U C T S
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the construction sector continues to recover from the effects of the pandemic, demand for specialty tape from contractors will expand. Over the coming years, interest rates are expected to stabilize as the Federal Reserve reaches its inflation target. This will lead to more confident consumers, which boosts demand for construction projects. With workers increasingly returning to the office and the value of construction on the rise, demand for tape products is likely to swell. Elevated mortgages can negatively impact demand from the construction sector, as it might slow down the residential sector, potentially slowing down demand for tape producers in the years to come.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: G R O W I N G  D E M A N D  I S  L I K E L Y  T O  B E N E F I T  D O M E S T I C  P R O D U C E R S
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Improving economic conditions also boost demand from the manufacturing sector, as consumers spend more on discretionary and premium purchases. The recovery of the manufacturing sector will also support revenue growth. As disposable income grows, consumers will be able to increase discretionary spending, boosting demand for tape products. Box-sealing tape, electrical and rubber tape and high-visibility reflective tape are expected to see a rise in their sales due to increased industrial production and government funding. The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is likely to continue generating consistent demand over the years to come as tape products are used broadly by the construction sector.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: G L O B A L I Z A T I O N  T R E N D S  A R E  L I K E L Y  T O  S P I L L  O V E R  T O  C O M I N G  Y E A R S
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Trade activity is expected to continue growing, although at a slower pace. The perceived high quality of domestically produced tape will continue generating significant revenue.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures a range of tapes, including gummed sealing tape, paper base and reinforced adhesive tapes, among other related products. Additional products manufactured by the industry include a variety of pressure-sensitive products and adhesives.
key_trends: Uncertain economic conditions weaken demand for tape products.
During times of economic uncertainty, the construction and manufacturing sectors slow down due to lower spending from consumers and businesses.

Globalization is both a threat and an opportunity. Although affordable, imported tape creates direct competition to tape producers, the higher perceived quality of US produced tape attracts more consumers domestically and overseas.
The industry benefits from multiple trade agreements. This enables exporting producers to lower operating costs, although it also enables imports to grow.
The Bipartisan Infrastructure Law is expected to generate steady revenue. Many infrastructure construction projects use products like reflective and electrical tape, boosting demand for producers.
Tape sales rely heavily on the construction sector. Recent revenue losses can be partially attributed to weaker demand for construction projects.
Larger tape products dominate the industry. These products have a broad range of uses, making it highly attractive for downstream producers.
Tape producers remain near downstream manufacturers. Since the manufacturing sector generates a large portion of revenue, tape producers aim to base operations near manufacturing hubs.

Basing operations near major trade routes is crucial for producers. Operating out of regions like the Southeast, the West, the Mid-Atlantic and the Great Lakes often lead to lower transportation costs.
Producers are increasingly competing with foreign producers. Trade agreements and a strong dollar make imported products more affordable for consumers, resulting in higher external competition.
There is room for specialization in the moderately saturated industry. Smaller producers can focus on serving niche markets, which often results in higher profit.
Major producers aim to adapt to changing preferences. This has led them to develop new products that meet these demands, such as sustainable and vegan tape products.
Large companies acquire smaller competitors. This enables them to grow their market share and expand their product offering.
Supply chain disruptions resulted in elevated input prices. Weaker demand for tape products forced producers to absorb these costs.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Tape Producers Serve Various Direct Industries. Many direct industries, including construction, automotive, pharmaceuticals and consumer electronics, use heavy-duty industrial tape. Industrial tape is often sold in bulk, in varying shapes, sizes, colors and functions and is developed with special qualities like chemical resistance, humidity resistance, UV resistance and stronger adhesion. The use of high-strength materials found in thread seal tape, electrical tape and duct tape offer added benefits for many building and construction applications.

General Industries Generate Lower Revenue. The general industries segment refers to the overall appliance sector and revenue generated by consumers, DIYs and craftsmen. Consumers in this market segment use tape for daily activities and do not rely on adhesive tape products as much as direct industries.

products_and_services.product_description: Self-adhesive Tape, 20.0 cm or Greater in Width, is Broadly Popular Among Manufacturing Buyers. Standard tape is used in a variety of home, office, commercial and industrial applications. Plastic tape can either be adhesive on both sides or can have one side backed with nonadhesive plastic or plastic-type material. Plastic tape often comes in rolls, although some come in prefabricated bulk strips of differing quantities. Types of plastic tape include plastic plates, sheets, film, foil, strips and other flat surfaces, and comes in various sizes and packaging. Larger tape products with added qualities are often preferred for industrial production as producers can specialize and focus on a niche sector of the market. These products are often more expensive and sold at larger quantities, forcing them to generate higher revenue. Changes in demand for manufactured products directly impact the sales of larger tape products.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Self-adhesive plastic tape, under 20.0 cm width
products_and_services.product_description: Self-adhesive Plastic Tape, Less Than 20.0 cm in Width, Has Fewer Uses. The industry makes an important distinction between the use of adhesive tape that is greater than or less than 20.0 centimeters in width. This distinction helps manufacturers simplify and isolate their manufacturing processes. Although the manufacturing processes for both sizes are generally identical, most industrial applications for tape require much larger tape sizes based on the project. Smaller tape products often have specialized uses, causing demand for smaller tape products to generate significantly lower revenue.

Transparent Tape is More Resistant. Transparent tape consists of nonplastic transparent tape products, including heat-shrinkable polyolefin tape and clear vinyl tape that can be applied and removed without leaving behind an adhesive residue. These products are mostly used for industrial applications, as they conform to unconventional surfaces easily and can often resist heavy weathering and abrasion.

Reflective Tape is Popular for Construction Projects. Reflective tape is commonly applied to mailboxes, bicycles, buildings and protective clothing and is frequently applied to signs and fixtures along the US highway system. Reflective tape is used frequently in commercial, industrial and public works applications. Reflective tape provides high visibility and brightness at night when exposed to a source of light.

Contractors and Blue-Collar Workers Rely on Electrical and Rubberized Tape. Electrical and rubberized tape is popular for minor household, commercial and industrial applications. Electrical tape is commonly used to insulate electrical wires and protect these high-voltage materials from dangerous exposure to moisture, sunlight, liquids, open flames and dangerous chemicals. For safety reasons, electrical and rubberized tape tends to be very durable, difficult to tear and relatively pliable.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Rising consumer spending has a positive effect on tape sales. Improving macroeconomic conditions make consumers more likely to buy adhesive tape for personal packaging needs.

Paper producers are major consumers of tape, which they require to manufacture items such as coated and laminated paper. When printing and publishing activity increases, paper manufacturing activity grows to meet demand.

The trade-weighted index (TWI) measures the value of the US dollar relative to the currencies of major US trading partners. Tape manufacturers are harmed by a strong US dollar through weaker export demand and stronger import competition.
Adhesive tape is used for packaging consumer goods. These products are used for sealing boxes, external packaging and internal packaging of large items.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand From Drywall and Insulation Installers
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Drywall and insulation installers use electrical tape for multiple projects. When these services are in demand (typically when construction activity grows in the United States), demand for electrical tape also grows.
